ground_truth_articulation: The input is labeled True if it contains three or more punctuation marks from the set {. , ! ? ; :}.
generated_articulation: The output is True when the input contains at least one word with internal punctuation (non-alphabetic characters within the word) and at least one other word that is purely alphabetic, indicating the presence of both types of words; otherwise, the output is False.
raw_response: The output is True when the input contains at least one word with internal punctuation (non-alphabetic characters within the word) and at least one other word that is purely alphabetic, indicating the presence of both types of words; otherwise, the output is False.
llm_judge_reasoning: The ground truth rule classifies an input as True if it contains three or more punctuation marks from a specific set, focusing solely on punctuation count. The generated rule classifies an input as True if it contains both at least one word with internal punctuation and at least one purely alphabetic word, emphasizing the presence of different word types rather than punctuation count. These rules are based on different key features—punctuation versus word composition—and are unlikely to produce the same classifications consistently. They do not identify the same patterns or core concepts, making their equivalence minimal.
